At the first crow of the rooster, before rising, first bend the left hand to lick the salt from the finger, then extend the right hand to gaze at the salted finger, rubbing them together while reciting:

*"The daughter of the Queen Mother of the West is named Yi Yu. She bestows upon me the cinnabar elixir, which I receive into my mouth, accumulating essence to polish my form."*

At every cock’s crow, swallow saliva twice seven times to dispel the dimness of the eyes, drawing forth their radiant essence so that one’s vision may penetrate ten thousand *li* and perceive all four directions. After swallowing saliva twice seven times, rub the eyes with the fingers twice seven times to prevent drowsiness—this is what is meant by *"spitting on the hands and rubbing the eyes with Yang Brightness."*

The above is recorded in the *Nine Capitals*.

Next, tap the teeth, sounding the drum of the Heavenly Gate thirty-six times. Then swish the divine springwater and swallow it three times—this is called *"sounding the Heavenly Drum"* and visualizes the myriad spirits of the body.

The above is recorded in various texts.

Upon rising at dawn, sit facing east. Rub the hands together until warm, then rub the forehead upward to the top of the head, repeating this eighteen times—this is called *"Muddy Pellet."* Next, rub the hands together again until warm, then rub the face, passing into the hairline three times. If one can thoroughly rub the entire body, it is even better—this is called *"Dry Bathing."*

Next, after rubbing the hands and touching the forehead, clasp the ears with the hands and pull them upward and downward fourteen times to ensure lifelong hearing. Then, contracting the nose and holding the breath, use the right hand to pull the left ear from above the head fourteen times, then the left hand to pull the right ear fourteen times—this grants longevity.

When dressing, one should don the belt facing *wu-ji*. For example:
- During the *jia-xu* decade, face *yin*;
- During the *jia-yin* decade, face *wu*;
- During the *jia-shen* decade, face *zi*;
- During the *jia-wu* decade, face *xu*;
- During the *jia-chen* decade, face *shen*;
- During the *jia-zi* decade, face *chen*.

This is what is meant by *"donning the belt facing* wu-ji*"* to remain perpetually free from cold.

When walking, always step forward first with the left foot while saying *"Qian,"* then with the right foot while saying *"Yuan,"* then with the left foot while saying *"Heng,"* then with the right foot while saying *"Li,"* and finally with the left foot while saying *"Zhen."* This completes the sequence—it is called *"Walking the Qian-Yuan."*

When making a request, state your name aloud:
*"Left-aligned spirit, right-aligned spirit, Earth Controller of Destiny, Azure Lady, sever [Name]’s entry in the register of death. Gatekeeper Lord, grant this to the Lady."*

If assent is given, repeat it quietly, ensuring the voice does not carry too far.

When relieving oneself, face the direction of the Six *Ding*. For example:
- During the *jia-zi* decade, face *ding-mao* (east);
- During the *jia-xu* decade, face *chou*;
- During the *jia-shen* decade, face *hai*;
- During the *jia-wu* decade, face *you*;
- During the *jia-chen* decade, face *wei*;
- During the *jia-yin* decade, face *si*.

This is what is meant by *"facing the Six Ding when relieving oneself."*

The above eight methods are recorded in the *Scripture of Spontaneity*.

Before eating or drinking, first state your name and declare:
*"I establish my body as the Dao, my body as the Heavenly Repository. Dao Father, Dao Mother, Perfected Ones, Immortals, Divine Ones, Sages—I join with you in this meal. Divine youths and jade maidens attend at my left, holding my immortal register, granting me boundless life."*

The above is recorded in the *Essentials of the Dao*.

**Method for Absorbing the Essence of the Sun and Moon:**
On the first day of the lunar month, when the sun has risen three *zhang* high, gaze toward it, clench the fists, and perform the *Yu Step*. From afar, draw in the sun’s essence with the mouth twenty-four times and swallow it. If three people enter a plague-stricken household in this manner, no illness will afflict those accompanying them. Practicing this regularly ensures longevity.

On the third day of the lunar month, when the moon rises in the *geng* position, clench the fists, walk southwest, face the moon, perform the *Yu Step*, and from afar draw in the moon’s essence with the mouth twenty-four times, swallowing it. This ensures a year free from illness. It also allows one to enter households of the deceased, for the sun and moon illuminate all impurities.

The above two methods—*"eating the sun and drinking the moon"*—dissolve all *qi*.

*"Born together with the Dao, dwelling with the spirits in the same hall, Perfected One [Name], who dares speak of my demise?"*
Recite this when the ears ring.

*"Dwelling with the Dao, sharing a chamber with the spirits, Perfected One [Name], may my lifespan match heaven and earth."*
Recite this at the first cock’s crow.

*"Sharing a chamber with the Dao, sharing merit with the spirits, Perfected One [Name], may my lifespan unite with heaven and earth."*
Recite this at the second cock’s crow.

When traveling at night, invoke *"Heavenly Peng"* to stand before you and repel tigers and wolves.

Recite this when walking at night.

At dawn and dusk, face north. First visualize the *qi* of the five viscera:
- The *qi* of the liver as true blue,
- The *qi* of the heart as true red,
- The *qi* of the lungs as true white,
- The *qi* of the kidneys as true black,
- The *qi* of the spleen as true yellow.

Once the *qi* of the five viscera is settled, tap the teeth thirty-six times and recite:
*"Heavenly Peng, Heavenly Peng, Nine Origins Slaying Youth, Five Ding Controllers, Gao Diao Northern Duke, Seven Governors Eight Spirits, Supreme One Dispels Misfortune, Long-Skulled Giant Beast, Grasping the Emperor’s Bell, White Owl of the Three Mornings, Sternly Driving the Kui Dragon Chariot, Mighty Sword Divine King, Slaying Demons and Erasing Traces, Purple Qi Riding the Sky, Cinnabar Clouds Blazing Forth, Devouring Demons and Consuming Ghosts, Body Transverse Drinking the Wind, Azure Tongue Green Teeth, Four-Eyed Old Man, Heavenly Ding Warriors, Mighty South Warding Off Misfortune, Heavenly Couriers Rousing Fury, Mighty North Biting the Blade, Three Hundred Thousand Soldiers, Guarding My Ninefold Gates, Repelling Corpses a Thousand *Li* Away, Further Dispelling Inauspiciousness. Should any petty ghost dare approach to harm me, seize the Heavenly Great Axe and sever the five forms of ghosts. The Fiery Emperor scorches their blood, the Northern Emperor burns their bones, the Four Brightnesses shatter their skeletons, Heavenly Strategy annihilates their kind. With a single stroke of the divine blade, ten thousand ghosts scatter."*

Recite this incantation to ward off ghosts, tapping the teeth once for every four lines.

All ghosts under heaven submit in awe. Should any seek to harm you, they will vanish upon hearing this incantation. The Great Demon of the Northern Emperor constantly fears this prayer. Those who regularly employ it may traverse the world unopposed, with gods and ghosts submitting in obedience.

chunks.original_text: 不可妄言有此祝法，常秘而行之。 师口诀曰：身未精洁，不可轻行咒法，子宜慎之。 常以鸡呜时握固，戴天柱，叩齿二七通，思十二父母绕头，思二十四神人布在身，思二十四贤在地绕身，便以左脚踵塞大孔，更急握固，反舌向喉中，闭气，思王气在前，思天下神祇、山川五岳精灵神官，下及一切万民，皆来朝己，从天至地，莫不震伏者，毕乃通息。 右太一包天大禁法。 魄昼日在左目下，暮在鼻下人中，常以旦暮，以右手第二指阴按之三过，微祝曰： 七魄澡炼，不动不倾，长与三魂，隐伏帝庭，保和三元，通真达灵，万凶消灭，我得长生，遂为真人，上升天庭。 右太一制七魄法，常行之，三魂保守，七魄长安，无复死时，常行之，勿使人见。 若登斋入室，当先驱除以辟鬼病，又防百试，乃宽内府而祝之，北向叩齿三十六通，乃微言於玉清琼元君曰： 六天大魔王，受制幽寥无，巨兽赤甲，毒龙四喉，白鼠仰呜，奋爪振豪，万精幽匿，灭邪破妖，天丁一如，五岳启朝，风火征伐，九天扇飙，照矣。 於是重挺闭视，澡练容精，调研三宫，存一六庭，帝君撰晏，卿辅并明，和适气液，朝谒九灵，五神安迭，津源流盈，白元启真，无英布生，洞景潜朗，四德以平，晖皓内宝，歌玩洞清，太素列图，寿亦不倾。 本命之日，及有心震之地，闭关精思，叩齿三过，安气呼吸，正身北向，心存而微言曰： 罗勒那朝，方奈关练，班目勃队，惮漠巨蛇，赫察白鼠，丹梨大魔，真馥广敷，虚灵峙霄，总览吉凶，发洞畅幽，舞眄众品，领括繁条，百方千涂，莫不豁寥，天地齐度，孰云能雕。 右二条出《洞真金玄八景玉箓》咒法，不可轻咒，慎之。 大寒者以鼻取气，三咽不息，为咽取气即止矣。 大热者以鼻取气，再咽令迟，亦先鼻内气，后口呼出气，热即止。 右二条出《黄子行气经》中。 尔时八万五千金刚神为护法，故调伏幽明二众之心，而说咒曰： 雷火明空，神光朗幽，毒龙四据，灵虎八周，头巾七星，足踏斗牛，神刀列宿，金钩耀精，元首威兵，腾步虚行，中绝妖邪，下灭游精，抽肝出胆，翻肠绝脉，左斩右到，煎烹后馘，截妖气原，收束众怨，啖鬼使者，摧拉生吞，巫俗歌鼓，饮血食肉，形膻骨臭，魍魉翻覆，腥躁秽贱，心形谄讟，神杵碎首，金刀刎腹，藏凶匿害，忽来降伏，左秉金符，右持罪目，太一金铃，虚皇玉节，知过不改，悬首自截，何妖不丧，何精不灭，六神不藏，七星裂血，上有天师，下有金刚，齐称降气，口吐灵芒，饮以丹池，饴以玄霜，五藏生华，长存不疆。 尔时大鬼王四目电身，同为护法，消灭不祥，守卫道场，察奸纠过，降伏恶人，及诸外道，无止信者，而说咒曰： 神风拂尘，倾拔邪根，六天丧精，五毒亡冤，金头铁齿，啖鬼亡魂，桃光列户，双景曜门，奔星杀气，朗然无畏，百脉川流，七经调理，神安体平，长存不死。 右二咒出《太上玉清经》第七《道化四夷品》。 酆都宫颂曰： 纣绝标帝神，谅事遘重阿，炎如霄中烟，勃若曜景华，武城带神锋，恬照吞清河，阊阖临丹井，云门郁嵯峨，七非通奇盖，连宛亦敷魔，六天横北道，此是鬼神家。 此六天之宫名，诵之辟鬼邪也。 寂通寄兴感，玄气摄动音，高轮虽参差，万仞故来寻，萧萧研道子，合神契灵衿，委顺浪世化，心标窈窕林，同期理外游，相与静东岑。

Do not recklessly reveal the existence of this incantation method; keep it secret and practice it diligently.

The master’s oral instructions state: If the body is not pure and refined, one must not lightly perform the incantation rites. You ought to be cautious of this.

Regularly at cock’s crow, clench the fists, raise the Celestial Pillar, and tap the teeth twice seven times. Envision the Twelve Parent Deities encircling the head, the Twenty-Four Divine Persons arrayed upon the body, and the Twenty-Four Sages surrounding the earth beneath you. Then, press the left heel against the anus, clench the fists tightly once more, curl the tongue back toward the throat, hold the breath, and visualize the Kingly *qi* before you. Envision all the gods of heaven and earth, the spirits of mountains and rivers, the Five Peaks, and all living beings coming to pay homage to you—from heaven to earth, none dare not tremble in submission. Only then release the breath.

*Right: The Great One’s Celestial Encompassing Prohibition.*

The *po* soul by day resides beneath the left eye, and at dusk beneath the nose in the philtrum. Regularly at dawn and dusk, press with the second finger of the right hand three times while softly reciting:

The seven *po* are refined and purified,
Unmoving and unyielding,
Ever conjoined with the three *hun*,
Concealed within the Imperial Court.
They preserve harmony of the Three Origins,
Communing with the true and penetrating the numinous.
All misfortune vanishes,
And I attain longevity,
Becoming a Perfected One,
Ascending to the Celestial Court.

*Right: The Great One’s Method for Restraining the Seven *Po*.* Practice this regularly, and the three *hun* will be guarded, the seven *po* will remain at peace, and death shall never come. Perform this without others witnessing.

When entering a purification chamber or sacred space, first expel and dispel ghosts and illnesses. Guard against all trials, then relax the inner palace and recite, facing north and tapping the teeth thirty-six times. Softly address the Jade Clarity’s Resplendent Primordial Sovereign:

The Great Demon Kings of the Six Heavens,
Bound in the desolate void,
Giant beasts of crimson armor,
Poisonous dragons with four throats,
White rats howling upward,
Brandishing claws and shaking bristles,
Myriad spirits lurking in darkness—
Vanquish evil and shatter demons.
The Heavenly Soldiers are as one,
The Five Peaks pay homage.
Wind and fire launch their assault,
The Nine Heavens fan the whirlwind.
Behold!

Then, straighten the spine, close the eyes, refine the countenance and essence, harmonize the Three Palaces, and visualize the Six Courts. The Imperial Lord holds court, his ministers and aides all radiant. Harmonize the *qi* and fluids, pay homage to the Nine Numinous Ones, the Five Spirits rest in succession, the springs of saliva overflow, the White Prime awakens the true, the Dark Flower spreads its life. The cavernous radiance shines in secret, the Four Powers are balanced, the inner treasure gleams brightly. Sing and delight in the Cavernous Clarity, the Primal Simplicity arrays its charts, and longevity shall never falter.

On one’s natal day or in places where the heart trembles, close the passes and refine the thoughts, tap the teeth thrice, regulate the breath, face north, and softly intone:

*Roluona chao, Fangnai guanlian,*
*Banmu bo dui, Danmo ju she,*
*Hecha bai shu, Danli da mo,*
*Zhenfu guangfu, Xuling zhi xiao,*
*Zonglan jixiong, Fa dong chang you,*
*Wumian zhongpin, Lingkuo fan tiao,*
*Baifang qian tu, Moneng huo liao,*
*Tiandi qidu, Shu yun neng diao.*

*Right: These two passages are from the* Incantations of the *Jade Register of the Eight Luminaries of the Cavernous Realms of Golden Mystery.* Do not recite them lightly; be cautious.

For extreme cold: Inhale through the nose, swallow the *qi* thrice without exhaling, and cease once the *qi* is drawn in.

For extreme heat: Inhale through the nose, swallow the *qi* twice slowly, first drawing in through the nose, then exhaling through the mouth. The heat will subside.

*Right: These two passages are from the* Scripture of Qi Circulation by Master Huang.

At that time, eighty-five thousand vajra spirits acted as Dharma protectors, subduing the minds of both the hidden and the manifest, and spoke this incantation:

Lightning fire illumines the void,
Divine radiance brightens the obscure.
Poisonous dragons crouch at the four quarters,
Spiritual tigers encircle the eight directions.
The headscarf bears the Seven Stars,
The feet tread upon Dipper and Ox.
The divine blade arrays the constellations,
The golden hook gleams with essence.
The foremost wields mighty soldiers,
Striding through the void.
Sever the center of demonic evil,
Annihilate the wandering spirits below.
Tear out the liver, extract the gall,
Invert the intestines, sever the vessels.
Cut left, strike right,
Boil and decapitate the rear.
Sever the root of demonic *qi*,
Bind and restrain all grudges.
The ghost-eating messengers,
Crush and devour them alive.
Sorcerers and shamans with drums and songs,
Drinking blood and eating flesh,
Foul of form and stinking of bone,
*Wangliang* spirits overturned.
Rank and filthy, base and vile,
Hearts and forms full of flattery and slander.
The divine pestle shatters their skulls,
The golden blade slits their bellies.
Those who conceal evil and hide harm,
Suddenly submit.
In the left hand, the golden talisman,
In the right, the ledger of sins.
The Great One’s golden bell,
The Jade Emperor’s jade scepter.
Those who know their faults yet do not reform,
Hang their heads and sever themselves.
What demon does not perish?
What spirit does not vanish?
The Six Spirits do not hide,
The Seven Stars spill blood.
Above, the Heavenly Master,
Below, the vajras.
Together they subdue the *qi*,
Mouths spewing divine radiance.
Drink from the Cinnabar Pool,
Feed upon the Mysterious Frost.
The Five Viscera bloom with flowers,
Abiding forever, unending.

At that time, the Great Ghost King with four eyes and a body like lightning, together as Dharma protectors, dispelled inauspiciousness, guarded the ritual space, detected deceit and corrected faults, subdued evil men and all external paths, and those lacking faith. They spoke this incantation:

Divine wind sweeps away dust,
Uprooting the roots of evil.
The Six Heavens lose their essence,
The Five Poisons perish their grudges.
Golden head and iron teeth,
Devouring ghosts and vanishing souls.
Peach light arrays the doors,
Twin luminaries shine upon the gates.
Shooting stars and killing *qi*,
Radiant and fearless.
The hundred vessels flow like rivers,
The seven meridians are regulated.
The spirit is at peace, the body is balanced,
Abiding forever, undying.

*Right: These two incantations are from the* Supreme Jade Clarity Scripture*, Chapter Seven, "The Dao Transforms the Four Barbarians."*

The *Hymn of the Fengdu Palace* states:

Zhou’s end marks the divine emperor,
In truth, affairs meet heavy calamity.
Flaming like smoke in the sky,
Bursting like radiant blossoms.
Wucheng girds the divine blade,
Serene illumination swallows the Clear River.
The Gate of Heaven overlooks the Cinnabar Well,
Cloud Gate looms precipitously.
The Seven Wrongs connect to the wondrous canopy,
Linked and winding, they spread demons.
The Six Heavens cross the northern path—
This is the abode of ghosts and spirits.

These are the names of the Six Heavenly Palaces. Reciting them dispels ghostly and demonic influences.

Silent communion conveys inspired feeling,
Mysterious *qi* stirs the resonant tone.
Though the lofty wheel is uneven,
From ten thousand fathoms, they still come seeking.
The diligent Daoist disciples,
Harmonizing spirit and contracting the numinous lapel,
Surrender to the transformations of the floating world,
The heart’s standard planted in the secluded forest.
Together we await the journey beyond principle,
And with one another, still the eastern peak.

On the mountain are six palaces; within the grotto, six more—each palace spanning a thousand *li* in circumference. These are the Six Heavenly Palaces of ghosts and spirits.

The palaces above the mountain are the outer courts; those within the grotto, the inner courts—their systems are the same.
